trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with InsideView | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with InsideView | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use InsideView with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use InsideView with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with InsideView
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with InsideView

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529077).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529077).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and InsideView.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and InsideView.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A InsideView tenant
trans-unit.target: A InsideView tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to InsideView will be able to single sign into the application at your InsideView company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to InsideView will be able to single sign into the application at your InsideView company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for InsideView
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for InsideView

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for InsideView
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for InsideView

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for InsideView.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for InsideView.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for InsideView, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for InsideView, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **InsideView**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **InsideView**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **InsideView**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **InsideView**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: InsideView
trans-unit.target: InsideView

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to InsideView with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to InsideView with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **InsideView** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **InsideView** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single SignOn
trans-unit.target: Configure Single SignOn

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to InsideView** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to InsideView** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single SignOn
trans-unit.target: Configure Single SignOn

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **InsideView Reply URL** textbox, type your InsideView SSO URL (e.g.: `https://my.insideview.com/iv/<STS Name>/login.iv`), and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **InsideView Reply URL** textbox, type your InsideView SSO URL (e.g.: `https://my.insideview.com/iv/<STS Name>/login.iv`), and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure App URL
trans-unit.target: Configure App URL

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at InsideView** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at InsideView** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single SignOn
trans-unit.target: Configure Single SignOn

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your InsideView company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your InsideView company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click **Admin**, **SingleSignOn Settings**, and then click **Add SAML**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click **Admin**, **SingleSignOn Settings**, and then click **Add SAML**.

trans-unit.source: SAML Single Sign On Settings
trans-unit.target: SAML Single Sign On Settings

trans-unit.source: In the **Add a New SAML** section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add a New SAML** section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Add a New SAML
trans-unit.target: Add a New SAML

trans-unit.source: In the **STS Name** textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the **STS Name** textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at InsideView** dialog page, copy the **Service Provider (SP) Initiated Endpoint** value, and then paste it into the **SamlP/WS-Fed Unsolicated EndPoint** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at InsideView** dialog page, copy the **Service Provider (SP) Initiated Endpoint** value, and then paste it into the **SamlP/WS-Fed Unsolicated EndPoint** textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a **base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a **base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the **STS Certificate** textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the **STS Certificate** textbox

trans-unit.source: In the **Crm User Id Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Crm User Id Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Crm Email Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Crm Email Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Crm First Name Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Crm First Name Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Crm lastName Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Crm lastName Mapping** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single SignOn
trans-unit.target: Configure Single SignOn

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into InsideView, they must be provisioned into InsideView.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into InsideView, they must be provisioned into InsideView.

trans-unit.source: In the case of InsideView, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of InsideView, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To get users or contacts created in InsideView, contact your customer success manager or send email to **support@insideview.com**
trans-unit.target: To get users or contacts created in InsideView, contact your customer success manager or send email to **support@insideview.com**

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other InsideView user account creation tools or APIs provided by InsideView to provision Azure AD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other InsideView user account creation tools or APIs provided by InsideView to provision Azure AD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to InsideView, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to InsideView, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **InsideView **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **InsideView **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
